param.name: crop_raster
param.dialogReference: CropScape Raster

param.name: output_folder
param.dialogReference: Location of Output files

param.name: value_acre
param.dialogReference: Value that blank crop values default to

param.name: winter_months
param.dialogReference: When populated crops will be considered growing during this season. Delete and leave blank if no winter crops.

param.name: spring_months
param.dialogReference: When populated crops will be considered growing during this season. Delete and leave blank if no spring crops.

param.name: summer_months
param.dialogReference: When populated crops will be considered growing during this season. Delete and leave blank if no summer crops.

param.name: fall_months
param.dialogReference: When populated crops will be considered growing during this season. Delete and leave blank if no fall crops.

param.name: curve
param.displayname: Depth-Damage Curve (depth in ft:fraction, comma separated)
param.dialogReference: Pairs of flood depth and damage fraction, e.g., "0:0,1:0.5,2:1". Editing the points changes how quickly losses climb with depth, directly affecting damage totals

param.name: specific_curves
param.expression: {Crop Code {Depth-Damage Curve} {Grow Months};Crop Code {Depth-Damage Curve} {Grow Months}...}
param.dialogReference: Depth-Percent Damage curves for specific crops. List the NASS crop code, curve, and grow months for each crop added.

param.name: event_info
param.dialogReference: Table of flood events with depth rasters, flood month, and return period. Example row: "C:\\data\\100yr.tif", 6, 100. Modifying rows changes scenarios and their frequency, influencing expected damage.

param.name: uncertainty
param.dialogReference: Standard deviation applied to damage fractions during Monte Carlo simulations (e.g., 0.1 is a 10% deviation from the input value). Higher values introduce more variability and uncertainty in results.

param.name: mc_runs
param.dialogReference: Number of Monte Carlo iterations for each event per year (e.g., 100). Increasing the count stabilizes averages but lengthens processing time.

param.name: random_seed
param.dialogReference: Seed for the random number generator (e.g., 42) to ensure reproducible simulations. Changing it yields different random sequences and damage outcomes.

param.name: random_month
param.dialogReference: If True, randomly selects the flood month instead of using the provided month. Randomizing months can move events into or out of the growing season, altering damages.

param.name: random_season
param.dialogReference: If True, randomly selects the flood season instead of using the provided month. Randomizing seasons can move events into or out of the growing season, altering damages.

param.name: season_probs
param.dialogReference: Influences how likely the random season occurs within the Monte Carlo simulation

param.name: depth_stddev
param.dialogReference: Standard deviation for adding normally distributed noise to flood depths (e.g., 0.25). Larger values produce greater depth variation, affecting interpolated damage fractions.

param.name: value_stddev
param.dialogReference: Standard deviation for crop values per acre (e.g., 150). Increasing the deviation widens the range of possible crop values, changing overall damage estimates.

param.name: analysis_years
param.dialogReference: Number of years to simulate for each event (e.g., 30). Extending the period scales damages across more years of exposure.

param.name: damage_points
param.dialogReference: Optional feature class storing per-pixel average damage for visualization, such as a shapefile or geodatabase path. Creating this output enables spatial analysis but increases processing time; leaving it blank skips this step.
